title: Newcastle v Arsenal: Premier League – live
summary: Newcastle faces off against Mikel Arteta's title-chasing team, aiming to build on their recent strong performances. A live minute-by-minute report by Rob Smyth will provide updates during the match. Fans are eager to see if Newcastle can maintain their momentum against the formidable opponents.

title: Ryder Cup 2025: USA 5-12 Europe after Hovland withdraws from singles – live
summary: Scott Murray is providing live hole-by-hole updates on the 11 singles matches following Viktor Hovland's withdrawal due to injury. Stay tuned for the latest developments and scores. Follow along for in-depth commentary and analysis throughout the matches.

title: Polly McDonald obituary
summary: A former television production assistant and manager transitioned into a career advisor, helping media professionals navigate their career paths. Their expertise and experience in the industry provided valuable insights to those seeking guidance. Through this role, they made a significant impact on the careers of aspiring media personnel.

title: Starmer calls Reform’s policy on immigration ‘racist’ and says Farage’s party would ‘tear country apart’ – Labour conference live
summary: The Prime Minister criticized Reform's policy as immoral but acknowledged that voters supporting the party are driven by frustration rather than racism. He emphasized understanding the sentiments behind their choices. The comments reflect ongoing tensions in political discourse regarding immigration and social policies.

title: WSL roundup: Chelsea stay unbeaten as Agyemang helps Brighton to narrow win
summary: Chelsea extended their perfect start in the Women's Super League (WSL) season with a dominant performance against West Ham. They netted three goals within just seven minutes in the first half. The victory highlights their strong form as the season progresses.
